titles.title: Providing amounts for the expenses of the Select Subcommittee on the United States Role in Iranian Arms Transfers to Croatia and Bosnia of the Committee on International Relations in the second session of the One Hundred Fourth Congress.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.
Committee Approved Measure with an Amendment in the Nature of a Substitute by Yea-Nay vote: 7 - 5.
Mr. Hyde asked unanimous consent that the Committee on House Oversight have until midnight on May 6 to file a report on H. Res. 417. Agreed to without objection.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on House Oversight. H. Rept. 104-559.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 217.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the resolution and on the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 203 (Roll no. 152).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 05/08/1996--Passed House amended.    (There are 2 other summaries). Provides amounts out of the applicable accounts of the House of Representatives for the expenses of the Select Subcommittee on the United States Role in Iranian Arms Transfers to Croatia and Bosnia of the House Committee on International Relations in the second session of the 104th Congress. Permits the use of such funds for procurement of consultant services. Authorizes the Committee on House Oversight to adjust amounts for investigations and studies if necessary to comply with a sequestration order of the President or to conform to any reduction in appropriations.
